intro: Lepechinia coccinea, commonly known as the scarlet lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Lepechinia coccinea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
